title.value: Impact of a vaccine passport on first-dose SARS-CoV-2 vaccine coverage by age and area-level social determinants of health in the Canadian provinces of Quebec and Ontario: an interrupted time series analysis
title.justification: This is the full title of the research paper as provided at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Impact of a vaccine passport on first-dose SARS-CoV-2 vaccine coverage by age and area-level social determinants of health in the Canadian provinces of Quebec and Ontario: an interrupted time series analysis

extractions.description: The paper evaluates the impact of vaccine passport policies on first-dose SARS-CoV-2 vaccination coverage in Quebec and Ontario, considering factors like age and area-level social determinants such as income and racial demographics.

type.justification: The paper uses empirical methods such as interrupted time series analyses to evaluate the impact of vaccine passport policies based on real-world data from vaccine registries.
type.quote: Methods: We performed interrupted time series analyses using data from Quebec’s and Ontario’s vaccine registries linked to census information.

name.justification: The paper deals with the impact of health policies, specifically vaccine passports, on public health outcomes in terms of vaccine coverage.
name.quote: Interpretation: In the context of high vaccine coverage across 2 provinces, the announcement of vaccine passports had a small impact on first-dose coverage.

name.justification: The study is concerned with vaccination coverage, which is a topic within the field of epidemiology.
name.quote: Once vaccines became widely available in 2021 in high-income countries, many governments implemented proof-of-vaccination policies to further mitigate the pandemic’s impacts on population health and the economy.

name.justification: The paper considers social determinants of health such as area-level income and racial demographics.
name.quote: We sought to evaluate the impact of vaccine passport policies on first-dose SARS-CoV-2 vaccination coverage by age, and area-level income and proportion of racialized residents.

name.justification: The research uses data from the vaccine registries of Quebec and Ontario for its analysis.
name.quote: Methods: We performed interrupted time series analyses using data from Quebec’s and Ontario’s vaccine registries linked to census information.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not provide a specific title for a referenced paper related to the datasets used.
